00027 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LND
00028 
00029 #include "gnilnd.h"
00030 
00031 #define GNILND_PEERSTATE_STRLEN 16
00032 typedef struct kgn_sysctl_data {
00033         int                     ksd_pause_trigger;
00034         int                     ksd_quiesce_secs;
00035         int                     ksd_rdmaq_override;
00036         char                    ksd_peer_state[GNILND_PEERSTATE_STRLEN];
00037 } kgn_sysctl_data_t;
00038 
00039 static kgn_sysctl_data_t        kgnilnd_sysctl;
00040 
00041 #if defined(CONFIG_SYSCTL)
00042 
00043 static struct ctl_table_header *kgnilnd_table_header = NULL;
00044 
00045 static int
00046 proc_toggle_thread_pause(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
00047                          void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00048 {
00049         int  old_val = kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_pause_trigger;
00050         int  rc = 0;
00051         ENTRY;
00052 
00053         rc = proc_dointvec(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00054         if (!write) {
00055                 /* read */
00056                 RETURN(rc);
00057         }
00058 
00059         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init != GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00060                 rc = -EINVAL;
00061                 RETURN(rc);
00062         }
00063 
00064         if (old_val != kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_pause_trigger) {
00065                 mutex_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
00066                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "setting quiesce_trigger %d\n", old_val);
00067                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger = kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_pause_trigger;
00068                 kgnilnd_quiesce_wait("admin sysctl");
00069                 mutex_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
00070         }
00071 
00072         RETURN(rc);
00073 }
00074 
00075 static int
00076 proc_hw_quiesce(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00077                 size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00078 {
00079         int              rc = 0;
00080         kgn_device_t    *dev;
00081         ENTRY;
00082 
00083         rc = proc_dointvec(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00084         if (!write) {
00085                 /* read */
00086                 RETURN(rc);
00087         }
00088 
00089         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init != GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00090                 rc = -EINVAL;
00091                 RETURN(rc);
00092         }
00093 
00094 
00095         /* only device 0 gets the handle, see kgnilnd_dev_init */
00096         dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00097 
00098         LASSERTF(dev != NULL, "dev 0 is NULL\n");
00099 
00100         kgnilnd_quiesce_end_callback(dev->gnd_handle,
00101                                      kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_quiesce_secs * MSEC_PER_SEC);
00102 
00103         RETURN(rc);
00104 }
00105 
00106 static int
00107 proc_trigger_stack_reset(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
00108                          void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00109 {
00110         int              rc = 0;
00111         int              i = 1;
00112         kgn_device_t    *dev;
00113         ENTRY;
00114 
00115         if (!write) {
00116                 /* read */
00117                 rc = proc_dointvec(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00118                 RETURN(rc);
00119         }
00120 
00121         /* only device 0 gets the handle, see kgnilnd_dev_init */
00122         dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[0];
00123 
00124         LASSERTF(dev != NULL, "dev 0 is NULL\n");
00125 
00126         kgnilnd_critical_error(dev->gnd_err_handle);
00127 
00128         /* Wait for the reset to complete.  This prevents any races in testing
00129          * where we'd immediately try to send traffic again */
00130         while (kgnilnd_data.kgn_needs_reset != 0) {
00131                 i++;
00132                 LCONSOLE((((i) & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
00133                                 "Waiting for stack reset request to clear\n");
00134                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00135                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1 * i));
00136         }
00137 
00138         RETURN(rc);
00139 }
00140 
00141 static int
00142 proc_toggle_rdmaq_override(struct ctl_table *table, int write,
00143                            void __user *buffer, size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00144 {
00145         int  old_val = kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_rdmaq_override;
00146         int  rc = 0;
00147         ENTRY;
00148 
00149         rc = proc_dointvec(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00150         if (!write) {
00151                 /* read */
00152                 RETURN(rc);
00153         }
00154 
00155         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init != GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00156                 rc = -EINVAL;
00157                 RETURN(rc);
00158         }
00159 
00160         if (old_val != kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_rdmaq_override) {
00161                 long    new_mb = kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_rdmaq_override * (long)(1024*1024);
00162                 LCONSOLE_INFO("changing RDMAQ override to %d mbytes/sec\n",
00163                               kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_rdmaq_override);
00164                 /* override proc is mbytes, but we calc in bytes */
00165                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_rdmaq_override = new_mb;
00166                 smp_wmb();
00167         }
00168 
00169         RETURN(rc);
00170 }
00171 
00172 /* /proc/sys entry point for injecting up/down nid event
00173  * <up|down> <nid>
00174  */
00175 static int
00176 proc_peer_state(struct ctl_table *table, int write, void __user *buffer,
00177                 size_t *lenp, loff_t *ppos)
00178 {
00179         int             rc;
00180         int             nid;
00181         int             node_down;
00182         char            command[10];
00183         ENTRY;
00184 
00185         rc = proc_dostring(table, write, buffer, lenp, ppos);
00186 
00187         if (!write) {
00188                 /* read */
00189                 RETURN(rc);
00190         }
00191 
00192         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init != GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
00193                 rc = -EINVAL;
00194                 RETURN(rc);
00195         }
00196 
00197         /* convert to nid, up/down values */
00198         rc = sscanf(kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_peer_state, "%s %d", command, &nid);
00199         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "command %s, nid %d\n", command, nid);
00200 
00201         if (rc != 2) {
00202                 CDEBUG(D_ERROR, "invalid parameter\n");
00203                 RETURN(rc);
00204         } else {
00205                 switch (command[0]) {
00206                 case 'd': /* down */
00207                         node_down = 1;
00208                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "take node %d down\n", nid);
00209                         break;
00210                 case 'u': /* up */
00211                         node_down = 0;
00212                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "bring node %d up\n", nid);
00213                         break;
00214                 default:
00215                         CDEBUG(D_ERROR, "invalid command %s\n", command);
00216                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00217                 }
00218         }
00219 
00220         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "proc_peer_state: reporting node_down %d, nid %d\n",
00221                       node_down, nid);
00222         rc = kgnilnd_report_node_state(nid, node_down);
00223 
00224         if (rc) {
00225                 rc = -EINVAL;
00226         }
00227 
00228         RETURN(rc);
00229 }
00230 
00231 static struct ctl_table kgnilnd_table[] = {
00232         /*
00233          * NB No .strategy entries have been provided since sysctl(8) prefers
00234          * to go via /proc for portability.
00235          */
00236         {
00237                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00238                 .procname = "version",
00239                 .data     = KGNILND_BUILD_REV,
00240                 .maxlen   = sizeof(KGNILND_BUILD_REV),
00241                 .mode     = 0444,
00242                 .proc_handler = &proc_dostring
00243         },
00244         {
00245                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00246                 .procname = "thread_pause",
00247                 .data     = &kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_pause_trigger,
00248                 .maxlen   = sizeof(int),
00249                 .mode     = 0644,
00250                 .proc_handler = &proc_toggle_thread_pause,
00251         },
00252         {
00253                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00254                 .procname = "hw_quiesce",
00255                 .data     = &kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_quiesce_secs,
00256                 .maxlen   = sizeof(__u32),
00257                 .mode     = 0644,
00258                 .proc_handler = &proc_hw_quiesce,
00259         },
00260         {
00261                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00262                 .procname = "stack_reset",
00263                 .data     = NULL,
00264                 .maxlen   = sizeof(int),
00265                 .mode     = 0600,
00266                 .proc_handler = &proc_trigger_stack_reset,
00267         },
00268         {
00269                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00270                 .procname = "rdmaq_override",
00271                 .data     = &kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_rdmaq_override,
00272                 .maxlen   = sizeof(int),
00273                 .mode     = 0644,
00274                 .proc_handler = &proc_toggle_rdmaq_override,
00275         },
00276         {
00277                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00278                 .procname = "peer_state",
00279                 .data     = kgnilnd_sysctl.ksd_peer_state,
00280                 .maxlen   = GNILND_PEERSTATE_STRLEN,
00281                 .mode     = 0644,
00282                 .proc_handler = &proc_peer_state,
00283         },
00284         { 0 }
00285 };
00286 
00287 static struct ctl_table kgnilnd_top_table[2] = {
00288         {
00289                 INIT_CTL_NAME
00290                 .procname = "kgnilnd",
00291                 .data     = NULL,
00292                 .maxlen   = 0,
00293                 .mode     = 0555,
00294                 .child    = kgnilnd_table
00295         },
00296         { 0 }
00297 };
00298 
00299 void kgnilnd_insert_sysctl(void)
00300 {
00301         if (kgnilnd_table_header == NULL)
00302                 kgnilnd_table_header = register_sysctl_table(kgnilnd_top_table);
00303 }
00304 
00305 void kgnilnd_remove_sysctl(void)
00306 {
00307         if (kgnilnd_table_header != NULL)
00308                 unregister_sysctl_table(kgnilnd_table_header);
00309 
00310         kgnilnd_table_header = NULL;
00311 }
00312 
00313 #else
00314 void kgnilnd_insert_sysctl(void) {}
00315 void kgnilnd_remove_sysctl(void) {}
00316 #endif
